     <path d="M13.2020619 19v-7.3106996h2.5072165l.6268041-3.127572h-3.0164949V6.37242798s.1958763-1.0946502 1.0969072-1.0946502h1.8412372V2.5020576h-2.6247423s-3.4865979.46913582-3.4865979 3.36213993v2.6584362H7.67835052v3.08847737h2.42886598v7.3497942H1.99793814C.90103094 18.9609053 0 18.0617284 0 16.9670782V1.99382716C0 .89917696.90103093 0 1.99793814 0H17.0020619C18.0989691 0 19 .89917696 19 1.99382716V16.9670782c0 1.0946502-.9010309 1.9938271-1.9979381 1.9938271h-3.7608248L13.2020619 19z" />

           <div data-reactid="81" class="post-title-data">
            <meta content="What is the best language and tool for doing web scraping?" itemprop="name" data-reactid="82">
            <h1 itemprop="headline" data-reactid="83"><a data-reactid="84" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6">What is the best language and tool for doing web scraping?</a></h1>
            <span data-reactid="85">
             <meta content="9" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="86">
             <meta content="15" itemprop="answerCount" data-reactid="87"></span>
           </div>
           <div data-reactid="88" class="post-meta-desc">
            <div data-reactid="89" itemprop="description">
             <p>I have heard beautiful soup library in python is great but cheerio is great option as well. What language and tool is apt for this task?</p> 
            </div>
           </div>
           <div data-reactid="90" class="spp-post-tags">
            <span data-reactid="91"><a data-reactid="92" href="/n/python" data-is-deleted="false" data-is-approved="true" data-id="56744721958ef13879b94d67" data-slug="python">Python</a></span>
            <span data-reactid="93"><a data-reactid="94" href="/n/nodejs" data-is-deleted="false" data-is-approved="true" data-id="56744722958ef13879b94ffb" data-slug="nodejs">NodeJS</a></span>
            <meta content="Python,NodeJS" itemprop="keywords" data-reactid="95">

             <meta content="2016-02-11T09:04:56.265Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="168">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/ciki1holk004qsf53m0yymg6i" itemprop="url" data-reactid="169">
             <div data-reactid="170" class="response-stickers-container">
              <p data-reactid="171">
               <!-- react-text: 172 -->This 
               <!-- /react-text -->
               <!-- react-text: 173 -->answer
               <!-- /react-text -->
               <!-- react-text: 174 --> has received 
               <!-- /react-text -->
               <!-- react-text: 175 -->2
               <!-- /react-text -->
               <!-- react-text: 176 --> appreciation
               <!-- /react-text -->
               <!-- react-text: 177 -->s
               <!-- /react-text -->
               <!-- react-text: 178 -->.
               <!-- /react-text --></p>
              <ul class="inline-list badges-list" data-reactid="179">
               <li data-reactid="180"><a data-reactid="181" href="#" data-active-tab="appreciators"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1447773026/badges/appr-2.png" data-reactid="182"><span data-reactid="183" class="badge-count">1</span><span data-reactid="184" class="badge-title">Cup</span></a></li>
               <li data-reactid="185"><a data-reactid="186" href="#" data-active-tab="appreciators"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1447773026/badges/appr-9.png" data-reactid="187"><span data-reactid="188" class="badge-count">1</span><span data-reactid="189" class="badge-title">Cool</span></a></li>
              </ul>
             </div>
             <div data-reactid="190" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="191" itemprop="description">
               <p>I think it really depends on what kinds of website you are scraping. If those websites using static type page (like php+mysql), you can use any language (like python) to download the page and parse the data. However, if those websites using javascript to dynamically load the data, you have to use some tools to simulate the javascript engine. </p> 
               <p>I recently use CasperJS (<a href="http://casperjs.org/">http://casperjs.org/</a>) to parse a big database website, which loads data through javascript. You can find many video tutorials online like this one.</p> 
               <p><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kefil5tCL9o">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kefil5tCL9o</a></p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="192">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="193">
              <meta content="4" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="194"></span>
             <div data-reactid="195" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="196" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="197"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="198"></i><span data-reactid="199" class="btnText">4</span></button>
               <a data-reactid="200" href="#" class="footerAct replyAct">
                <!-- react-text: 201 -->Reply
                <!-- /react-text --><span data-reactid="202" class="countBadge">2</span></a>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="203" class="RightActWrap">
               <span data-reactid="204" class="shareAct"><button class="footerAct shareBtn" data-reactid="205" title="Share">

               <div data-reactid="245" class="reply-editor-wrap">
                <div data-reactid="246" class="_3r5AlqSQ5xeBPo-eQ_-GSY _923WTu-Dit9zrjNDrtIZZ">
                 <!-- react-empty: 247 -->
                 <div data-reactid="248" class="WcmEsSxvtdmjppeQCvd0w reply-textarea">
                  <div data-reactid="249" class="DraftEditor-root">
                   <div data-reactid="250" class="public-DraftEditorPlaceholder-root">

                     Write a reply...
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <div data-reactid="252" class="DraftEditor-editorContainer">
                    <div data-reactid="253" class="public-DraftEditor-content" aria-describedby="placeholder-ctoji" contenteditable="true" role="textbox" spellcheck="true" style="outline:none;white-space:pre-wrap;word-wrap:break-word">
                     <div data-reactid="254" data-contents="true">
                      <div data-reactid="255" class="lbgWvolvc8ZRJwK4L3Fx-" data-block="true" data-editor="ctoji" data-offset-key="8lkef-0-0">
                       <div data-reactid="256" class="public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="8lkef-0-0">
                        <span data-reactid="257" data-offset-key="8lkef-0-0"><br data-text="true" data-reactid="258"></span>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="259" class="reply-act-wrap">
               <label class="send-check" data-reactid="260"><input data-reactid="261" type="checkbox">
                <!-- react-text: 262 -->Enter to reply
                <!-- /react-text --></label>
               <div data-reactid="263" class="right-act">
                <button class="act-btn submit" data-reactid="264" disabled>Post</button>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div data-reactid="265">
           <div data-reactid="266" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="267" class="response-card" id="cikhzz2c9002rfa5316yanrfl">
             <div data-reactid="268" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="269" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="270" href="/@JanVladimirMostert" class="userPic" data-username="JanVladimirMostert"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1446708198/h8vlib1varvaeb6yfzul.jpg" alt="" data-reactid="271"></a>
               <div data-reactid="272" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="Jan Vladimir Mostert" itemprop="name" data-reactid="273">
                <meta content="/@JanVladimirMostert" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="274">
                <meta content="http://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1446708198/h8vlib1varvaeb6yfzul.jpg" itemprop="image" data-reactid="275">
                <p data-reactid="276" class="name"><a data-reactid="277" href="/@JanVladimirMostert" class="user-name" itemprop="url">Jan Vladimir Mostert</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="278" class="info"><a data-reactid="279" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikhzz2c9002rfa5316yanrfl">11 Feb 2016</a><span data-reactid="280" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 281 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 282 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="283" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="284"><a data-reactid="285" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="286" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="287" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="288" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-11T08:22:28.000Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="289">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikhzz2c9002rfa5316yanrfl" itemprop="url" data-reactid="290">
             <div data-reactid="291" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="292" itemprop="description">
               <p>With Python, Beautiful Soup works very well to correct broken HTML, used it many years ago and I'm sure it's improved a lot since.</p> 
               <p>With Java I'm using Jsoup, same great experience and ease of use. Getting Java to scrape many web pages using httpClient is much easier to build due to the threading model. </p> 
               <p>Last time I used Python for heavy duty scraping, I had to dig deep to find thread-safe classes in order to get it to scrape many pages at the same time, got it working and scraping 7-10GB of <a href="/util/redirect?url=http://BBC.co.uk" class="autolinkedURL autolinkedURL-url external-link" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">BBC.co.uk</a> content per night (this was 7 years ago, so it was considered a great scraper considering the limitations of the server it was running on), but it was somewhat messy due to Python not having that many thread-safe classes at the time.</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="293">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="294">
              <meta content="4" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="295"></span>
             <div data-reactid="296" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="297" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="298"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="299"></i><span data-reactid="300" class="btnText">4</span></button>
               <a data-reactid="301" href="#" class="footerAct replyAct">
                <!-- react-text: 302 -->Reply
                <!-- /react-text --><span data-reactid="303" class="countBadge">2</span></a>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="304" class="RightActWrap">
               <span data-reactid="305" class="shareAct"><button class="footerAct shareBtn" data-reactid="306" title="Share">

                  <p data-reactid="329" class="reply-creator-info"><a data-reactid="330" href="/@JanVladimirMostert" class="reply-creator">Jan Vladimir Mostert</a><span data-reactid="331" class="middot"> · </span><a data-reactid="332" href="#" class="replyDate">

                <div data-reactid="335" class="reply-text-content" itemprop="description">
                 <p>I've not used anything other than JSoup for parsing HTML, JSoup works very well.</p>

           <div data-reactid="367" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="368" class="response-card" id="ciki0146o003xsf53lgxfyjfy">
             <div data-reactid="369" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="370" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="371" href="/@josfaber" class="userPic" data-username="josfaber"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1498029082/escxgflqxu4kxj65x0qh_cropped.png" alt="" data-reactid="372"></a>
               <div data-reactid="373" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="Jos Fabre" itemprop="name" data-reactid="374">
                <meta content="/@josfaber" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="375">
                <meta content="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1498029082/escxgflqxu4kxj65x0qh_cropped.png" itemprop="image" data-reactid="376">
                <p data-reactid="377" class="name"><a data-reactid="378" href="/@josfaber" class="user-name" itemprop="url">Jos Fabre</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="379" class="info"><a data-reactid="380" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/ciki0146o003xsf53lgxfyjfy">11 Feb 2016</a><span data-reactid="381" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 382 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 383 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="384" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="385"><a data-reactid="386" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="387" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="388" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="389" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-11T08:24:03.697Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="390">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/ciki0146o003xsf53lgxfyjfy" itemprop="url" data-reactid="391">
             <div data-reactid="392" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="393" itemprop="description">
               <p>I love python for this. It's fast (both in coding and running), accepted and pre-installed on -or at least compatible with- almost any server architecture. Next to that it has a huge, dedicated community and ecosphere with tons of ready-to-use scripts, apps, frameworks. </p> 
               <p>I use it almost always for scraping sites, harvesting social content, converting (big) data.</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="394">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="395">
              <meta content="2" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="396"></span>
             <div data-reactid="397" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="398" class="left-section">

          <div data-reactid="434">
           <div data-reactid="435" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="436" class="response-card" id="ciklqhg9p00i3lf53obe3gjfx">
             <div data-reactid="437" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="438" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="439" href="/@cpbagley" class="userPic" data-username="cpbagley"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1446708188/ez4flkeanvo9rzuj7eys.png" alt="" data-reactid="440"></a>
               <div data-reactid="441" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="Christian Bagley" itemprop="name" data-reactid="442">
                <meta content="/@cpbagley" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="443">
                <meta content="http://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1446708188/ez4flkeanvo9rzuj7eys.png" itemprop="image" data-reactid="444">
                <p data-reactid="445" class="name"><a data-reactid="446" href="/@cpbagley" class="user-name" itemprop="url">Christian Bagley</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="447" class="info"><a data-reactid="448" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/ciklqhg9p00i3lf53obe3gjfx">13 Feb 2016</a><span data-reactid="449" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 450 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 451 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="452" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="453"><a data-reactid="454" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="455" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="456" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="457" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-13T23:07:54.404Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="458">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/ciklqhg9p00i3lf53obe3gjfx" itemprop="url" data-reactid="459">
             <div data-reactid="460" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="461" itemprop="description">
               <p>It seems the general consensus is in favor of Python, and I agree for a number of reasons. You mentioned Python's Beautiful Soup, which is likely one of the more publicly used and developed scraping libraries. As some of the other comments have mentioned, it takes a lot of the pain out of the process for you, and with the size of the Python (and Beautiful Soup) community you will likely never run into a problem that there isn't already a solution to. Aside from Beautiful Soup, Scrapy is another widely used crawling/scraping platform used in Python. </p> 
               <p>Python also plays well with Mongodb, in that there are a lot of packages to use them together - there are some for Beautiful Soup that bring MongoDB with it. And MongoDB is probably the database you'll work with if you're planning on web scraping, at least thats the DB I've seen clients use the most when doing scraping work. </p> 
               <p>Ruby isn't a bad choice either, with <a href="http://www.nokogiri.org/">Nokogiri</a> and <a href="https://rubygems.org/gems/mechanize">Mechanize</a>. Both of which are Ruby gems that are seen a lot (in regards to Ruby) in web scraping applications.</p> 
               <p>Both Ruby and Python are simple enough to jump into, you would be wrong in choosing either. Although, I'd suggest Python in the end. </p> 
               <p>If you feel like it, share your web scraping project with us, I'd be interested in seeing it!</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="462">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="463">
              <meta content="2" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="464"></span>
             <div data-reactid="465" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="466" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="467"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="468"></i><span data-reactid="469" class="btnText">2</span></button>
               <a data-reactid="470" href="#" class="footerAct replyAct">
                <!-- react-text: 471 -->Reply
                <!-- /react-text --></a>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="472" class="RightActWrap">
               <span data-reactid="473" class="shareAct"><button class="footerAct shareBtn" data-reactid="474" title="Share">
                 <svg data-reactid="475" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="14px" height="14px">
                  <use data-reactid="476" xlink:href="#share-line"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="477" class="shareText">Share</span></button></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div data-reactid="478" class="response-reply-wrap">
              <div data-reactid="479" class="response-reply-box">
               <div data-reactid="480" class="reply-img-wrap">
                <img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,g_face,c_thumb/v1447764059/static_imgs/anonym.png" data-reactid="481">
               </div>
               <div data-reactid="482" class="reply-editor-wrap">
                <div data-reactid="483" class="_3r5AlqSQ5xeBPo-eQ_-GSY _923WTu-Dit9zrjNDrtIZZ">
                 <!-- react-empty: 484 -->
                 <div data-reactid="485" class="WcmEsSxvtdmjppeQCvd0w reply-textarea">
                  <div data-reactid="486" class="DraftEditor-root">
                   <div data-reactid="487" class="public-DraftEditorPlaceholder-root">
                    <div data-reactid="488" class="public-DraftEditorPlaceholder-inner" id="placeholder-9mqr7">
                     Write a reply...
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <div data-reactid="489" class="DraftEditor-editorContainer">
                    <div data-reactid="490" class="public-DraftEditor-content" aria-describedby="placeholder-9mqr7" contenteditable="true" role="textbox" spellcheck="true" style="outline:none;white-space:pre-wrap;word-wrap:break-word">
                     <div data-reactid="491" data-contents="true">
                      <div data-reactid="492" class="lbgWvolvc8ZRJwK4L3Fx-" data-block="true" data-editor="9mqr7" data-offset-key="e3o9a-0-0">
                       <div data-reactid="493" class="public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="e3o9a-0-0">
                        <span data-reactid="494" data-offset-key="e3o9a-0-0"><br data-text="true" data-reactid="495"></span>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="496" class="reply-act-wrap">
               <label class="send-check" data-reactid="497"><input data-reactid="498" type="checkbox">
                <!-- react-text: 499 -->Enter to reply
                <!-- /react-text --></label>
               <div data-reactid="500" class="right-act">
                <button class="act-btn submit" data-reactid="501" disabled>Post</button>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
          <div data-reactid="502">
           <div data-reactid="503" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="504" class="response-card" id="cikns7oie00duqp534tcch45b">
             <div data-reactid="505" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="506" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="507" href="/@LLFourn" class="userPic" data-username="LLFourn"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1453353777/x5sd3tonviah7nvsmfuv.jpg" alt="" data-reactid="508"></a>
               <div data-reactid="509" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="LLFourn" itemprop="name" data-reactid="510">
                <meta content="/@LLFourn" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="511">
                <meta content="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1453353777/x5sd3tonviah7nvsmfuv.jpg" itemprop="image" data-reactid="512">
                <p data-reactid="513" class="name"><a data-reactid="514" href="/@LLFourn" class="user-name" itemprop="url">LLFourn</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="515" class="info"><a data-reactid="516" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikns7oie00duqp534tcch45b">15 Feb 2016</a><span data-reactid="517" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 518 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 519 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="520" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="521"><a data-reactid="522" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="523" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="524" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="525" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-15T09:31:50.103Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="526">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikns7oie00duqp534tcch45b" itemprop="url" data-reactid="527">
             <div data-reactid="528" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="529" itemprop="description">
               <p>I've done a lot of web scraping with Mojolicious' Mojo::UserAgent:</p> 
               <p><a href="http://mojolicious.org/perldoc/Mojo/UserAgent">http://mojolicious.org/perldoc/Mojo/UserAgent</a></p> 
               <p>as the example shows it's as simple as:</p> 
               <pre><code><span class="hljs-keyword">use</span> <span class="hljs-title">Mojo</span>::<span class="hljs-title">UserAgent</span>;
my $ua = Mojo::UserAgent-&gt;new;
say $ua-&gt;get(<span class="hljs-string">'blogs.perl.org'</span>)-&gt;res-&gt;dom-&gt;find(<span class="hljs-string">'h2 &gt; a'</span>)-&gt;map(<span class="hljs-string">'text'</span>)-&gt;join(<span class="hljs-string">"\n"</span>);
</code></pre>
               <p>If you need to execute JS, then CasperJS looks good.</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="530">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="531">
              <meta content="1" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="532"></span>
             <div data-reactid="533" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="534" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="535"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="536"></i><span data-reactid="537" class="btnText">1</span></button>

           <div data-reactid="571" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="572" class="response-card" id="cikjwnllp016nsf53ntn5ru0w">
             <div data-reactid="573" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="574" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="575" href="/@remyd1" class="userPic" data-username="remyd1"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1455293939/ma42vyhqao7nkwdgg6zq.png" alt="" data-reactid="576"></a>
               <div data-reactid="577" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="remy" itemprop="name" data-reactid="578">
                <meta content="/@remyd1" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="579">
                <meta content="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1455293939/ma42vyhqao7nkwdgg6zq.png" itemprop="image" data-reactid="580">
                <p data-reactid="581" class="name"><a data-reactid="582" href="/@remyd1" class="user-name" itemprop="url">remy</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="583" class="info"><a data-reactid="584" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikjwnllp016nsf53ntn5ru0w">12 Feb 2016</a><span data-reactid="585" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 586 -->

                 <!-- react-text: 587 -->answer

              <div data-reactid="588" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="589"><a data-reactid="590" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="591" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="592" xlink:href="#follow"></use>

             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-12T16:25:06.590Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="594">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikjwnllp016nsf53ntn5ru0w" itemprop="url" data-reactid="595">
             <div data-reactid="596" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="597" itemprop="description">
               <p>Personnally I used mechanize (which was firstly a perl library before being coded in python) some years ago and it was simply awesome. It is not only a "scraper"; you can put informations on websites, because you can emulate a whole Web browser... However It does not seems to be still under active development, so perhaps you should continue to use beautiful soup which just works fine. About mechanize: <a href="http://wwwsearch.sourceforge.net/mechanize/">http://wwwsearch.sourceforge.net/mechanize/</a> <a href="http://www.pythonforbeginners.com/cheatsheet/python-mechanize-cheat-sheet">http://www.pythonforbeginners.com/cheatsheet/python-mechanize-cheat-sheet</a></p> 
               <p>Best.</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="598">

             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-12T18:46:56.768Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="662">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikk1q03j01hqfl53iwtbj8q7" itemprop="url" data-reactid="663">
             <div data-reactid="664" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="665" itemprop="description">
               <p>As most of people here said, python is good for scraping static websites. For those rendered by javascript, i would recommend PhantomJS or CasperJS that do the job very well.</p> 
              </div>
             </div>

           <div data-reactid="707" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="708" class="response-card" id="cilaucnfy0022e053iup25up2">
             <div data-reactid="709" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="710" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="711" href="/@whiteninja" class="userPic" data-username="whiteninja"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1456923021/h1yrqwjuazd2eegk7ep2.png" alt="" data-reactid="712"></a>
               <div data-reactid="713" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="White Ninja" itemprop="name" data-reactid="714">
                <meta content="/@whiteninja" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="715">
                <meta content="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1456923021/h1yrqwjuazd2eegk7ep2.png" itemprop="image" data-reactid="716">
                <p data-reactid="717" class="name"><a data-reactid="718" href="/@whiteninja" class="user-name" itemprop="url">White Ninja</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="719" class="info"><a data-reactid="720" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cilaucnfy0022e053iup25up2">2 Mar 2016</a><span data-reactid="721" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 722 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 723 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="724" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="725"><a data-reactid="726" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="727" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="728" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="729" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2016-03-02T12:50:23.279Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="730">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cilaucnfy0022e053iup25up2" itemprop="url" data-reactid="731">
             <div data-reactid="732" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="733" itemprop="description">
               <p>I have used many web scraping software. My personal favorites are "fminer" and "content grabber". Fminer gives us facility of drawing action diagram which will be imitated by software again and again on websites while content grabber is unique in a way that it gives us facility of exporting scraping agents. By <a href="http://prowebscraping.com">http://prowebscraping.com</a></p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="734">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="735">
              <meta content="1" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="736"></span>
             <div data-reactid="737" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="738" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="739"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="740"></i><span data-reactid="741" class="btnText">1</span></button>
               <a data-reactid="742" href="#" class="footerAct replyAct">
                <!-- react-text: 743 -->Reply
                <!-- /react-text --></a>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="744" class="RightActWrap">
               <span data-reactid="745" class="shareAct"><button class="footerAct shareBtn" data-reactid="746" title="Share">
                 <svg data-reactid="747" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="14px" height="14px">
                  <use data-reactid="748" xlink:href="#share-line"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="749" class="shareText">Share</span></button></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div data-reactid="750" class="response-reply-wrap">
              <div data-reactid="751" class="response-reply-box">
               <div data-reactid="752" class="reply-img-wrap">
                <img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,g_face,c_thumb/v1447764059/static_imgs/anonym.png" data-reactid="753">
               </div>
               <div data-reactid="754" class="reply-editor-wrap">
                <div data-reactid="755" class="_3r5AlqSQ5xeBPo-eQ_-GSY _923WTu-Dit9zrjNDrtIZZ">
                 <!-- react-empty: 756 -->
                 <div data-reactid="757" class="WcmEsSxvtdmjppeQCvd0w reply-textarea">
                  <div data-reactid="758" class="DraftEditor-root">
                   <div data-reactid="759" class="public-DraftEditorPlaceholder-root">
                    <div data-reactid="760" class="public-DraftEditorPlaceholder-inner" id="placeholder-5iql1">
                     Write a reply...
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <div data-reactid="761" class="DraftEditor-editorContainer">
                    <div data-reactid="762" class="public-DraftEditor-content" aria-describedby="placeholder-5iql1" contenteditable="true" role="textbox" spellcheck="true" style="outline:none;white-space:pre-wrap;word-wrap:break-word">
                     <div data-reactid="763" data-contents="true">
                      <div data-reactid="764" class="lbgWvolvc8ZRJwK4L3Fx-" data-block="true" data-editor="5iql1" data-offset-key="bf477-0-0">
                       <div data-reactid="765" class="public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="bf477-0-0">
                        <span data-reactid="766" data-offset-key="bf477-0-0"><br data-text="true" data-reactid="767"></span>

                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="768" class="reply-act-wrap">

            <div data-reactid="844" class="response-card" id="cikj0weie00qwfl53i70urvj3">
             <div data-reactid="845" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="846" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="847" href="/@sportebois" class="userPic" data-username="sportebois"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1491334661/z2anaamumqj46ocvvbn5_cropped.png" alt="" data-reactid="848"></a>

                <p data-reactid="853" class="name"><a data-reactid="854" href="/@sportebois" class="user-name" itemprop="url">Sébastien Portebois</a></p>

                 <!-- react-text: 858 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 859 -->answer

              <div data-reactid="860" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="861"><a data-reactid="862" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">

             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-12T01:36:09.591Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="866">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikj0weie00qwfl53i70urvj3" itemprop="url" data-reactid="867">
             <div data-reactid="868" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="869" itemprop="description">
               <p>Although I'm only using their results, and not working directly on the scraping side of the data acquisition, co workers rely extensively on <a href="http://scrapy.org/">Scrapy</a> (And the related <a href="http://scrapinghub.com/">http://scrapinghub.com/</a> services for distributed proxies and everything to work around the blacklisting issues, but you can use scrapy on your own infrastructure for low volumes)</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="870">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="871">
              <meta content="1" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="872"></span>

              <div data-reactid="874" class="left-section">

                <!-- react-text: 879 -->Reply

              </div>

            <div data-reactid="912" class="response-card" id="cikibryyj00bxsf5306d1iu5q">
             <div data-reactid="913" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="914" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="915" href="/@mgiambanco" class="userPic" data-username="mgiambanco"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1454422460/gmodhlwlsfo9xuz2bxbi.jpg" alt="" data-reactid="916"></a>
               <div data-reactid="917" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="Mario Giambanco" itemprop="name" data-reactid="918">
                <meta content="/@mgiambanco" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="919">
                <meta content="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1454422460/gmodhlwlsfo9xuz2bxbi.jpg" itemprop="image" data-reactid="920">
                <p data-reactid="921" class="name"><a data-reactid="922" href="/@mgiambanco" class="user-name" itemprop="url">Mario Giambanco</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="923" class="info"><a data-reactid="924" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikibryyj00bxsf5306d1iu5q">11 Feb 2016</a><span data-reactid="925" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 926 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 927 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="928" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="929"><a data-reactid="930" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="931" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="932" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="933" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-11T13:52:52.412Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="934">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cikibryyj00bxsf5306d1iu5q" itemprop="url" data-reactid="935">
             <div data-reactid="936" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="937" itemprop="description">
               <p>Do make sure you have permission to scrape the website in question.</p> 
               <p>I make every effort to monitor for this activity at my day job, going so far as to strait up banning the IP address and sometimes, entire subnet of the offender. Bandwidth isn't cheap on large websites; nor is having our product stolen and stored somewhere else for all to download for free.</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="938">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="939">
              <meta content="1" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="940"></span>
             <div data-reactid="941" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="942" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="943"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="944"></i><span data-reactid="945" class="btnText">1</span></button>
               <a data-reactid="946" href="#" class="footerAct replyAct">
                <!-- react-text: 947 -->Reply
                <!-- /react-text --><span data-reactid="948" class="countBadge">1</span></a>
              </div>

          <div data-reactid="1003">
           <div data-reactid="1004" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="1005" class="response-card" id="ciki1xufn004jfl53bf6tjblj">
             <div data-reactid="1006" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="1007" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="1008" href="/@vasan" class="userPic" data-username="vasan"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/v1446708192/ij2ipxfkd38z2qbimjdx.png" alt="" data-reactid="1009"></a>
               <div data-reactid="1010" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="Vasan Subramanian" itemprop="name" data-reactid="1011">
                <meta content="/@vasan" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="1012">
                <meta content="http://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1446708192/ij2ipxfkd38z2qbimjdx.png" itemprop="image" data-reactid="1013">
                <p data-reactid="1014" class="name"><a data-reactid="1015" href="/@vasan" class="user-name" itemprop="url">Vasan Subramanian</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="1016" class="info"><a data-reactid="1017" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/ciki1xufn004jfl53bf6tjblj">11 Feb 2016</a><span data-reactid="1018" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 1019 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 1020 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="1021" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="1022"><a data-reactid="1023" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="1024" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="1025" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="1026" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2016-02-11T09:17:30.329Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="1027">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/ciki1xufn004jfl53bf6tjblj" itemprop="url" data-reactid="1028">
             <div data-reactid="1029" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="1030" itemprop="description">
               <p>I have used both beautiful soup (python) as well as cheerio (node). Both worked well. I'd recommend go with the language you're most familiar with -- python or node, and then pick the tool that's available. If you are equally familiar with both, then, choose Beautiful Soup because it's slightly richer as far as I remember. If you are familiar with neither, then too, pick python since it's easier to learn than node.</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="1031">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="1032">
              <meta content="1" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="1033"></span>
             <div data-reactid="1034" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="1035" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="1036"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="1037"></i><span data-reactid="1038" class="btnText">1</span></button>
               <a data-reactid="1039" href="#" class="footerAct replyAct">
                <!-- react-text: 1040 -->Reply
                <!-- /react-text --></a>
              </div>

             <meta content="2016-02-26T19:11:08.442Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="1095">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cil42r1ju00atze53vbwbax9x" itemprop="url" data-reactid="1096">
             <div data-reactid="1097" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="1098" itemprop="description">
               <p>I used Python with pyquery (a jquery-like library which builds upon BS). But then I turned to Go with goquery (same thing) in order to boost up parallelism and enjoy a modern type safe language. Both were adequate but I think I'll stick to Go for personal taste. </p> 
              </div>
             </div>

           <div data-reactid="1208" itemprop="comment" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/answer">
            <div data-reactid="1209" class="response-card" id="cj7b2wawa00le3qwty0hh4m9y">
             <div data-reactid="1210" class="response-header" itemprop="author" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
              <div data-reactid="1211" class="leftControls controlsSection">
               <a data-reactid="1212" href="/@abrahamstalin" class="userPic" data-username="abrahamstalin"><img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb/w_70/v1447764059/static_imgs/anonym.png" alt="" data-reactid="1213"></a>
               <div data-reactid="1214" class="userInfo">
                <meta content="Abraham Stalin (abrahamstalin)" itemprop="name" data-reactid="1215">
                <meta content="/@abrahamstalin" itemprop="sameAs" data-reactid="1216">
                <meta content="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,c_thumb,g_face/v1447764059/static_imgs/anonym.png" itemprop="image" data-reactid="1217">
                <p data-reactid="1218" class="name"><a data-reactid="1219" href="/@abrahamstalin" class="user-name" itemprop="url">Abraham Stalin (abrahamstalin)</a></p>
                <p data-reactid="1220" class="info"><a data-reactid="1221" href="/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cj7b2wawa00le3qwty0hh4m9y">7 Sep 2017</a><span data-reactid="1222" class="middot"> · </span>
                 <!-- react-text: 1223 --> 
                 <!-- /react-text -->
                 <!-- react-text: 1224 -->answer
                 <!-- /react-text --></p>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="1225" class="rightControls controlsSection">
               <span data-reactid="1226"><a data-reactid="1227" href="#" class="follow-button-profile userFollowBtn">
                 <svg data-reactid="1228" viewbox="0 0 101.97 108.27" width="13px" height="13px">
                  <use data-reactid="1229" xlink:href="#follow"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="1230" class="followText">Follow</span></a></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <meta content="2017-09-07T23:23:08.459Z" itemprop="dateCreated" data-reactid="1231">
             <meta content="https://hashnode.com/post/what-is-the-best-language-and-tool-for-doing-web-scraping-cikhw77jc000lsf53sfzmjjf6/answer/cj7b2wawa00le3qwty0hh4m9y" itemprop="url" data-reactid="1232">
             <div data-reactid="1233" class="response-desc">
              <div data-reactid="1234" itemprop="description">
               <p>Jsoup, is better but python it's easier to program.</p> 
               <p>Java is better but is difficult for new programmers.</p> 
               <p>I have compared the two with static pages and Java wins by 33.4%</p> 
               <p>For dynamic pages Java earns by 57.8%</p> 
              </div>
             </div>
             <span data-reactid="1235">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="downvoteCount" data-reactid="1236">
              <meta content="0" itemprop="upvoteCount" data-reactid="1237"></span>
             <div data-reactid="1238" class="response-footer">
              <div data-reactid="1239" class="left-section">
               <button class="footerAct upvote" data-reactid="1240"><i class="mdi mdi-thumb-up-outline" data-reactid="1241"></i><span data-reactid="1242" class="btnText text">Upvote</span></button>
               <a data-reactid="1243" href="#" class="footerAct replyAct">
                <!-- react-text: 1244 -->Reply
                <!-- /react-text --></a>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="1245" class="RightActWrap">
               <span data-reactid="1246" class="shareAct"><button class="footerAct shareBtn" data-reactid="1247" title="Share">
                 <svg data-reactid="1248" viewbox="0 0 16 16" width="14px" height="14px">
                  <use data-reactid="1249" xlink:href="#share-line"></use>
                 </svg><span data-reactid="1250" class="shareText">Share</span></button></span>
              </div>
             </div>
             <div data-reactid="1251" class="response-reply-wrap">
              <div data-reactid="1252" class="response-reply-box">
               <div data-reactid="1253" class="reply-img-wrap">
                <img src="https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/w_70,h_70,g_face,c_thumb/v1447764059/static_imgs/anonym.png" data-reactid="1254">
               </div>
               <div data-reactid="1255" class="reply-editor-wrap">
                <div data-reactid="1256" class="_3r5AlqSQ5xeBPo-eQ_-GSY _923WTu-Dit9zrjNDrtIZZ">
                 <!-- react-empty: 1257 -->
                 <div data-reactid="1258" class="WcmEsSxvtdmjppeQCvd0w reply-textarea">
                  <div data-reactid="1259" class="DraftEditor-root">
                   <div data-reactid="1260" class="public-DraftEditorPlaceholder-root">
                    <div data-reactid="1261" class="public-DraftEditorPlaceholder-inner" id="placeholder-cshtq">
                     Write a reply...
                    </div>
                   </div>
                   <div data-reactid="1262" class="DraftEditor-editorContainer">
                    <div data-reactid="1263" class="public-DraftEditor-content" aria-describedby="placeholder-cshtq" contenteditable="true" role="textbox" spellcheck="true" style="outline:none;white-space:pre-wrap;word-wrap:break-word">
                     <div data-reactid="1264" data-contents="true">
                      <div data-reactid="1265" class="lbgWvolvc8ZRJwK4L3Fx-" data-block="true" data-editor="cshtq" data-offset-key="3p9qt-0-0">
                       <div data-reactid="1266" class="public-DraftStyleDefault-block public-DraftStyleDefault-ltr" data-offset-key="3p9qt-0-0">
                        <span data-reactid="1267" data-offset-key="3p9qt-0-0"><br data-text="true" data-reactid="1268"></span>
                       </div>
                      </div>
                     </div>
                    </div>
                   </div>
                  </div>
                 </div>
                </div>
               </div>
              </div>
              <div data-reactid="1269" class="reply-act-wrap">
               <label class="send-check" data-reactid="1270"><input data-reactid="1271" type="checkbox">
                <!-- react-text: 1272 -->Enter to reply
                <!-- /react-text --></label>
               <div data-reactid="1273" class="right-act">
                <button class="act-btn submit" data-reactid="1274" disabled>Post</button>
               </div>
              </div>
             </div>
            </div>
           </div>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
        <div data-reactid="1275" class="sidebarColumn">
         <div data-reactid="1276" class="sppWidget newToHashnode">
          <div data-reactid="1277" class="widgetHeaderGrad"></div>
          <div data-reactid="1278" class="widgetContent">
           <h3 data-reactid="1279">Join a friendly and inclusive Q&amp;A network for coders</h3>
           <ul data-reactid="1280">
            <li data-reactid="1281"><span data-reactid="1282" class="emoji">?</span><span data-reactid="1283">Pick the technologies you like &amp; read great content through your feed.</span></li>
            <li data-reactid="1284"><span data-reactid="1285" class="emoji">?</span><span data-reactid="1286">Ask a question when you want to learn more about anything.</span></li>
            <li data-reactid="1287"><span data-reactid="1288" class="emoji">?</span><span data-reactid="1289">Share what you know &amp; build your portfolio.</span></li>

is the best language and tool for doing web scraping?&quot;,&quot;type&quot;:&quot;question&quot;,&quot;__v&quot;:25,&quot;followersCount&quot;:4,&quot;bookmarkedIn&quot;:[],&quot;hasReward&quot;:false,&quot;isPublication&quot;:false,&quot;numCollapsed&quot;:0,&quot;duplicatePosts&quot;:[],&quot;isDelisted&quot;:false,&quot;inviters&quot;:[],&quot;answeredByTarget&quot;:false,&quot;isEngaging&quot;:false,&quot;isActive&quot;:true,&quot;followers&quot;:[&quot;56adc4a383cf68e027c26b84&quot;,&quot;54b81b232807bee71445ebba&quot;,&quot;56589f4235adba6c617a24e3&quot;,&quot;56560a38cafcf1925df84899&quot;],&quot;responseCount&quot;:15,&quot;questionReplies&quot;:[],&quot;responses&quot;:[{&quot;content&quot;:&quot;&lt;p&gt;I think it really depends on what kinds of website you are scraping. If those websites using static type page (like php+mysql), you can use any language (like python) to download the page and parse the data. However, if those websites using javascript to dynamically load the data, you have to use some tools to simulate the javascript engine. &lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;I recently use CasperJS (&lt;a href=\\&quot;http://casperjs.org/\\&quot;&gt;http://casperjs.org/&lt;/a&gt;) to parse a big database website, which loads data through javascript. You can find many video tutorials online like this one.&lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=\\&quot;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kefil5tCL9o\\&quot;&gt;https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kefil5tCL9o&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\\n&quot;,&quot;contentMarkdown&quot;:&quot;I think it really depends on what kinds of website you are scraping. If those websites using static type page (like php+mysql), you can use any language (like python) to download the page and parse the data. However, if those websites using javascript to dynamically load the data, you have to use some tools to simulate the javascript engine. \\n\\nI recently use CasperJS (http://casperjs.org/) to parse a big database website, which loads data through javascript. You can find many video tutorials online like this one.\\n\\nhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kefil5tCL9o\\n\\n&quot;,&quot;author&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56b0faf20a7ca0c6f70c3895&quot;,&quot;username&quot;:&quot;sunghlin&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Sung-Han Town, South Africa&quot;,&quot;totalAppreciationBadges&quot;:201,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;55e7f50c0d874e422fb752d7&quot;},&quot;stamp&quot;:&quot;ciki56vsy006dsf53hdhmrqqx&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56bc66fec5074a2fb5cdc334&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:1,&quot;isActive&quot;:true,&quot;dateAdded&quot;:&quot;2016-02-11T10:48:30.850Z&quot;},{&quot;content&quot;:&quot;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=\\&quot;/@JanVladimirMostert\\&quot; class=\\&quot;user-mention\\&quot; target=\\&quot;_blank\\&quot; rel=\\&quot;noopener noreferrer\\&quot;&gt;@JanVladimirMostert&lt;/a&gt; It is a fair suggestion. I can also try this one too. Thanks&lt;/p&gt;\\n&quot;,&quot;contentMarkdown&quot;:&quot;@JanVladimirMostert It is a fair suggestion. I can also try this one too. Thanks&quot;,&quot;author&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56b0faf20a7ca0c6f70c3895&quot;,&quot;username&quot;:&quot;sunghlin&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Sung-Han Lin&quot;,&quot;photo&quot;:&quot;https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1454439185/vm7zo7ozh7s0x1ktckxa.jpg&quot;,&quot;tagline&quot;:&quot;Student, Software Engineer&quot;,&quot;badgesAwarded&quot;:[],&quot;totalUpvotesReceived&quot;:4,&quot;appreciations&quot;:[{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5ab9&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56bedc0ff7a8a564cd3cf3b5&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:1},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5ac0&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56bc4f17c5074a2fb5cdc320&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:1}],&quot;dateJoined&quot;:&quot;2016-02-02T18:52:34.929Z&quot;,&quot;socialMedia&quot;:{&quot;linkedin&quot;:&quot;https://tw.linkedin.com/in/sung-han-lin-0a47869&quot;,&quot;stackoverflow&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;google&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;facebook&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;twitter&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;github&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;website&quot;:&quot;&quot;},&quot;storiesCreated&quot;:[],&quot;numFollowing&quot;:0,&quot;numFollowers&quot;:0,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;Los Angeles&quot;,&quot;totalAppreciationBadges&quot;:2,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;56b0faf20a7ca0c6f70c3895&quot;},&quot;stamp&quot;:&quot;cikijr96a00frsf53lfwrptcf&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56bcc68fc5074a2fb5cdc372&quot;,&quot;upvotes&quot;:1,&quot;isActive&quot;:true,&quot;dateAdded&quot;:&quot;2016-02-11T17:36:15.923Z&quot;}],&quot;id&quot;:&quot;56bc4eb8c5074a2fb5cdc315&quot;},{&quot;content&quot;:&quot;&lt;p&gt;With Python, Beautiful Soup works very well to correct broken HTML, used it many years ago and I&amp;#39;m sure it&amp;#39;s improved a lot since.&lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;With Java I&amp;#39;m using Jsoup, same great experience and ease of use. Getting Java to scrape many web pages using httpClient is much easier to build due to the threading model. &lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;Last time I used Python for heavy duty scraping, I had to dig deep to find thread-safe classes in order to get it to scrape many pages at the same time, got it working and scraping 7-10GB of &lt;a href=\\&quot;/util/redirect?url=http://BBC.co.uk\\&quot; class=\\&quot;autolinkedURL autolinkedURL-url external-link\\&quot; target=\\&quot;_blank\\&quot; rel=\\&quot;nofollow\\&quot;&gt;BBC.co.uk&lt;/a&gt; content per night (this was 7 years ago, so it was  considered a great scraper considering the limitations of the server it was running on), but it was somewhat messy due to Python not having that many thread-safe classes at the time.&lt;/p&gt;\\n&quot;,&quot;contentMarkdown&quot;:&quot;With Python, Beautiful Soup works very well to correct broken HTML, used it many years ago and I&#39;m sure it&#39;s improved a lot since.\\n\\nWith Java I&#39;m using Jsoup, same great experience and ease of use. Getting Java to scrape many web pages using httpClient is much easier to build due to the threading model. \\n\\nLast time I used Python for heavy duty scraping, I had to dig deep to find thread-safe classes in order to get it to scrape many pages at the same time, got it working and scraping 7-10GB of BBC.co.uk content per night (this was 7 years ago, so it was  considered a great scraper considering the limitations of the server it was running on), but it was somewhat messy due to Python not having that many thread-safe classes at the time.&quot;,&quot;author&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;55e7f50c0d874e422fb752d7&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jan Vladimir Mostert&quot;,&quot;tagline&quot;:&quot;Idea Incubator, ladimirmostert.com&quot;},&quot;storiesCreated&quot;:[&quot;58f9c4a70a4b488da5cb58a3&quot;,&quot;58ede57af8429c5fdc4b797b&quot;,&quot;58d67dcb60b6e08edc7d2a27&quot;,&quot;58d64bf1bfc80091d03572ff&quot;,&quot;58d52c3f60b6e08edc7d290d&quot;,&quot;586be08586a586aec93324fc&quot;,&quot;58188e726c2fec00ae8c08b7&quot;,&quot;57fe59e32c83acc8cbf78be5&quot;,&quot;5756944d8e28cb12bb480a51&quot;,&quot;56f1a1f9990bca7c25e990b2&quot;,&quot;56eee1cfcb06805ba9b7c6d7&quot;,&quot;56d882f7696d94e491c06e3f&quot;,&quot;5698aad9ff99ae055eeff7cf&quot;,&quot;56952b8acad8946e563c589e&quot;,&quot;56850c394638b046d11274ae&quot;,&quot;5683ad3eedd71afbc8695ec5&quot;],&quot;numFollowing&quot;:23,&quot;numFollowers&quot;:2051,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;Cape love python for this. It&amp;#39;s fast (both in coding and running), accepted and pre-installed on -or at least compatible with- almost any server architecture. Next to that it has a huge, dedicated community and ecosphere with tons of ready-to-use scripts, apps, frameworks. &lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;I use it almost always for scraping sites, harvesting social content, converting (big) data.&lt;/p&gt;\\n&quot;,&quot;contentMarkdown&quot;:&quot;I love python for this. converting (big) data.&quot;,&quot;author&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;561b48c3ad669c4758e3a435&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Jos Fabre&quot;,&quot;tagline&quot;:&quot;full-stack father, developer, crafter&quot;,&quot;photo&quot;:&quot;https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1498029082/escxgflqxu4kxj65x0qh_cropped.png&quot;,&quot;username&quot;:&quot;josfaber&quot;,&quot;coverImage&quot;:&quot;https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1451281934/sbeu61a2z9ekl3s7byms.jpg&quot;,&quot;badgesAwarded&quot;:[],&quot;totalUpvotesReceived&quot;:666,&quot;appreciations&quot;:[{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5ab9&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;572cd722c9d8314d7d809842&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:4},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5abb&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56d98ceb4aa5f35f09dd6c5e&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:5},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5abf&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56d95b093003880b9665ba42&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:8},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5ab8&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56d9506bf5a939029636256e&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:4},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5ac0&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56aa20e8960088c21db4d7b6&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:6},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5aba&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56a83e13c343cfd61995292f&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:2},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5abe&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56a747cdc343cfd619952891&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:12},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5abd&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56a74337281161e11972fda8&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:10},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5abc&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56a1f92e46dfdb8479aa6b66&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:7}],&quot;dateJoined&quot;:&quot;2015-10-12T05:44:35.926Z&quot;,&quot;socialMedia&quot;:{&quot;linkedin&quot;:&quot;https://www.linkedin.com/in/jos-faber-1719a1131/&quot;,&quot;stackoverflow&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;google&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;facebook&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;twitter&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;github&quot;:&quot;https://github.com/josfaber&quot;,&quot;website&quot;:&quot;&quot;},&quot;storiesCreated&quot;:[&quot;5725a5c65ec4095ed6f48c16&quot;],&quot;numFollowing&quot;:22,&quot;numFollowers&quot;:352,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;Amsterdam, The Netherlands&quot;,&quot;totalAppreciationBadges&quot;:58,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;561b48c3ad669c4758e3a435&quot;},&quot;stamp&quot;:&quot;ciki0146o003xsf53lgxfyjfy&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56bc4523c5074a2fb5cdc30c&quot;,&quot;bookmarkedIn&quot;:[],&quot;isRewardWinner&quot;:false,&quot;totalBadgesAwarded&quot;:0,&quot;badgesAwarded&quot;:[],&quot;isCollapsed&quot;:false,&quot;downvotes&quot;:0,&quot;upvotes&quot;:2,&quot;isActive&quot;:true,&quot;dateAdded&quot;:&quot;2016-02-11T08:24:03.697Z&quot;,&quot;popularity&quot;:0.4387,&quot;replies&quot;:[],&quot;id&quot;:&quot;56bc4523c5074a2fb5cdc30c&quot;},{&quot;content&quot;:&quot;&lt;p&gt;It seems the general consensus is in favor of Python, and I agree for a number of reasons. You mentioned Python&amp;#39;s Beautiful Soup, which is likely one of the more publicly used and developed scraping libraries. As some of the other comments have mentioned, it takes a lot of the pain out of the process for you, and with the size of the Python (and Beautiful Soup) community you will likely never run into a problem that there isn&amp;#39;t already a solution to. Aside from Beautiful Soup, Scrapy is another widely used crawling/scraping platform used in Python. &lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;Python also plays well with Mongodb, in that there are a lot of packages to use them together - there are some for Beautiful Soup that bring MongoDB with it. And MongoDB is probably the database you&amp;#39;ll work with if you&amp;#39;re planning on web scraping, at least thats the DB I&amp;#39;ve seen clients use the most when doing scraping work. &lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;Ruby isn&amp;#39;t a bad choice either, with &lt;a href=\\&quot;http://www.nokogiri.org/\\&quot;&gt;Nokogiri&lt;/a&gt; and &lt;a href=\\&quot;https://rubygems.org/gems/mechanize\\&quot;&gt;Mechanize&lt;/a&gt;. Both of which are Ruby gems that are seen a lot (in regards to Ruby) in web scraping applications.&lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;Both Ruby and Python are simple enough to jump into, you would be wrong in choosing either. Although, I&amp;#39;d suggest Python in the end. &lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;If you feel like it, share your web scraping project with us, I&amp;#39;d be interested in seeing it!&lt;/p&gt;\\n&quot;,&quot;contentMarkdown&quot;:&quot;It seems the general consensus is in favor of Python, and I agree for a number of reasons. You mentioned Python&#39;s Beautiful Soup, which is likely one of the more publicly used and developed scraping libraries. As some of the other comments have mentioned, it takes a lot of the pain out of the process for you, and with the size of the Python (and Beautiful Soup) community you will likely never run into a problem that there isn&#39;t already a solution to. Aside from Beautiful Soup, Scrapy is another widely used crawling/scraping platform used in Python. \\n\\nPython also plays well with Mongodb, in that there are a lot of packages to use them together - there are some for Beautiful Soup that bring MongoDB with it. And MongoDB is probably the database you&#39;ll work with if you&#39;re planning on web scraping, at least thats the DB I&#39;ve seen clients use the most when doing scraping work. \\n\\nRuby isn&#39;t a bad choice either, with [Nokogiri](http://www.nokogiri.org/) and [Mechanize](https://rubygems.org/gems/mechanize). Both of which are Ruby gems that are seen a lot (in regards to Ruby) in web scraping applications.\\n\\nBoth Ruby and Python are simple enough to jump into, you would be wrong in choosing either. Although, I&#39;d suggest Python in the end. \\n\\nIf you feel like it, share your web scraping project with us, I&#39;d be interested in seeing it!&quot;,&quot;author&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;55f5c6aa6f297da64c7e7b1c&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;Christian Bagley&quot;,&quot;tagline&quot;:&quot;Data Privacy &amp; Security Researcher&quot;,&quot;photo&quot;:&quot;http://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1446708188/ez4flkeanvo9rzuj7eys.png&quot;,&quot;username&quot;:&quot;cpbagley&quot;,&quot;badgesAwarded&quot;:[],&quot;totalUpvotesReceived&quot;:8,&quot;appreciations&quot;:[{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5aba&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;5854ee4260b98d9b46af0661&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:1},{&quot;badge&quot;:&quot;567453d0b73d6a82ac8c5abf&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;57dc4f18f72dd3705c160925&quot;,&quot;count&quot;:1}],&quot;dateJoined&quot;:&quot;2015-09-13T18:55:38.538Z&quot;,&quot;socialMedia&quot;:{&quot;linkedin&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;stackoverflow&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;google&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;facebook&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;twitter&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;github&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;website&quot;:&quot;&quot;},&quot;storiesCreated&quot;:[],&quot;numFollowing&quot;:0,&quot;numFollowers&quot;:7,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;totalAppreciationBadges&quot;:2,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;55f5c6aa6f297da64c7e7b1c&quot;},&quot;stamp&quot;:&quot;ciklqhg9p00i3lf53obe3gjfx&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56bfb74a3ddee413591693f0&quot;,&quot;bookmarkedIn&quot;:[],&quot;isRewardWinner&quot;:false,&quot;totalBadgesAwarded&quot;:0,&quot;badgesAwarded&quot;:[],&quot;isCollapsed&quot;:false,&quot;downvotes&quot;:0,&quot;upvotes&quot;:2,&quot;isActive&quot;:true,&quot;dateAdded&quot;:&quot;2016-02-13T23:07:54.404Z&quot;,&quot;popularity&quot;:0.4387,&quot;replies&quot;:[],&quot;id&quot;:&quot;56bfb74a3ddee413591693f0&quot;},{&quot;content&quot;:&quot;&lt;p&gt;I&amp;#39;ve done a lot of web scraping with Mojolicious&amp;#39; Mojo::UserAgent:&lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=\\&quot;http://mojolicious.org/perldoc/Mojo/UserAgent\\&quot;&gt;http://mojolicious.org/perldoc/Mojo/UserAgent&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;as the example shows it&amp;#39;s as simple as:&lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;pre&gt;&lt;code&gt;&lt;span class=\\&quot;hljs-keyword\\&quot;&gt;use&lt;/span&gt; &lt;span class=\\&quot;hljs-title\\&quot;&gt;Mojo&lt;/span&gt;::&lt;span class=\\&quot;hljs-title\\&quot;&gt;UserAgent&lt;/span&gt;;\\nmy $ua = Mojo::UserAgent-&amp;gt;new;\\nsay $ua-&amp;gt;get(&lt;span class=\\&quot;hljs-string\\&quot;&gt;&#39;blogs.perl.org&#39;&lt;/span&gt;)-&amp;gt;res-&amp;gt;dom-&amp;gt;find(&lt;span class=\\&quot;hljs-string\\&quot;&gt;&#39;h2 &amp;gt; a&#39;&lt;/span&gt;)-&amp;gt;map(&lt;span class=\\&quot;hljs-string\\&quot;&gt;&#39;text&#39;&lt;/span&gt;)-&amp;gt;join(&lt;span class=\\&quot;hljs-string\\&quot;&gt;\\&quot;\\\\n\\&quot;&lt;/span&gt;);\\n&lt;/code&gt;&lt;/pre&gt;&lt;p&gt;If you need to execute JS, then CasperJS looks good.&lt;/p&gt;\\n&quot;,&quot;contentMarkdown&quot;:&quot;I&#39;ve done a lot of web scraping with Mojolicious&#39; Mojo::UserAgent:\\n\\nhttp://mojolicious.org/perldoc/Mojo/UserAgent\\n\\nas the example shows it&#39;s as simple as:\\n\\n\\tuse Mojo::UserAgent;\\n\\tmy $ua = Mojo::UserAgent-&gt;new;\\n\\tsay $ua-&gt;get(&#39;blogs.perl.org&#39;)-&gt;res-&gt;dom-&gt;find(&#39;h2 &gt; a&#39;)-&gt;map(&#39;text&#39;)-&gt;join(\\&quot;\\\\n\\&quot;);\\n\\nIf you need to execute JS, then CasperJS looks good.&quot;,&quot;author&quot;:{&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56a06abe46dfdb8479aa6a4b&quot;,&quot;username&quot;:&quot;LLFourn&quot;,&quot;name&quot;:&quot;LLFourn&quot;,&quot;photo&quot;:&quot;https://res.cloudinary.com/hashnode/image/upload/v1453353777/x5sd3tonviah7nvsmfuv.jpg&quot;,&quot;badgesAwarded&quot;:[],&quot;totalUpvotesReceived&quot;:1,&quot;appreciations&quot;:[],&quot;dateJoined&quot;:&quot;2016-01-21T05:21:02.563Z&quot;,&quot;socialMedia&quot;:{&quot;linkedin&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;stackoverflow&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;google&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;facebook&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;twitter&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;github&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;website&quot;:&quot;&quot;},&quot;storiesCreated&quot;:[],&quot;numFollowing&quot;:1,&quot;numFollowers&quot;:1,&quot;location&quot;:&quot;&quot;,&quot;totalAppreciationBadges&quot;:0,&quot;id&quot;:&quot;56a06abe46dfdb8479aa6a4b&quot;},&quot;stamp&quot;:&quot;cikns7oie00duqp534tcch45b&quot;,&quot;_id&quot;:&quot;56c19b06316f8ee15e9e0ecc&quot;,&quot;bookmarkedIn&quot;:[],&quot;isRewardWinner&quot;:false,&quot;totalBadgesAwarded&quot;:0,&quot;badgesAwarded&quot;:[],&quot;isCollapsed&quot;:false,&quot;downvotes&quot;:0,&quot;upvotes&quot;:1,&quot;isActive&quot;:true,&quot;dateAdded&quot;:&quot;2016-02-15T09:31:50.103Z&quot;,&quot;popularity&quot;:1033.7224,&quot;replies&quot;:[],&quot;id&quot;:&quot;56c19b06316f8ee15e9e0ecc&quot;},{&quot;content&quot;:&quot;&lt;p&gt;Personnally I used mechanize (which was firstly a perl library before being coded in python) some years ago and it was simply awesome. It is not only a &amp;quot;scraper&amp;quot;; you can put informations on websites, because you can emulate a whole Web browser... However It does not seems to be still under active development, so perhaps you should continue to use beautiful soup which just works fine.\\nAbout mechanize: \\n    &lt;a href=\\&quot;http://wwwsearch.sourceforge.net/mechanize/\\&quot;&gt;http://wwwsearch.sourceforge.net/mechanize/&lt;/a&gt;\\n    &lt;a href=\\&quot;http://www.pythonforbeginners.com/cheatsheet/python-mechanize-cheat-sheet\\&quot;&gt;http://www.pythonforbeginners.com/cheatsheet/python-mechanize-cheat-sheet&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\\n&lt;p&gt;Best.&lt;/p&gt;\\n&quot;,&quot;contentMarkdown&quot;:&quot;Personnally I used mechanize (which was firstly a perl library before being coded in python) some years ago and it was simply awesome. have used both beautiful soup (python) as well as cheerio (node). Both worked well. I&amp;#39;d recommend go with the language you&amp;#39;re most familiar with -- python or node, and then pick the tool that&amp;#39;s available. If you are equally familiar with both, then, choose Beautiful Soup because it&amp;#39;s slightly richer as far as I remember.
